text: Selective DNA - binding activity of <extra_id_0> interleukin-10 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - stimulated STAT molecules in human monocytes .

It has been demonstrated that <extra_id_0> interferon-gamma <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> IFN-gamma <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) and <extra_id_0> interleukin-10 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> IL-10 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) have various reverse effects on macrophages ; however , the molecular mechanism of this difference has not been fully understood .

In this study , we analyzed the binding activity of <extra_id_0> IL-10 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - and <extra_id_0> IFN-gamma <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - activated STAT molecules to two kinds of GAS-motif sequences .

<extra_id_0> IL-10 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - activated <extra_id_0> STAT1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> could bind to the GAS-motif sequence in the promoter region of the Fcgamma receptor , but not to that in the promoter region of the <extra_id_0> COX-2 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> gene , whereas <extra_id_0> IFN-gamma <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - activated <extra_id_0> STAT1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> STAT5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> could bind to both sequences .
<extra_id_0> IL-10 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> inhibited <extra_id_0> IFN-gamma <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - induced STAT activation without newly synthesized protein .
We further demonstrated that aspirin , but not dexamethasone , suppressed <extra_id_0> IFN-gamma <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - induced STAT activation .

Taken together , these results suggest that <extra_id_0> IL-10 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - activated <extra_id_0> STAT1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> has a specificity in binding to the GAS-motif sequences , whereas <extra_id_0> IFN-gamma <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - activated <extra_id_0> STAT1 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> STAT5 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> have a broader spectrum in binding to the GAS-motif sequences .

This may explain the difference between <extra_id_0> IL-10 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> and <extra_id_0> IFN-gamma <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> in biological activity , and the inhibitory effect of <extra_id_0> IL-10 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> on <extra_id_0> IFN-gamma <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> activities .
